name: Aebleskiver Batter and Bananas Foster Filling
description: If you've somehow found yourself in possession of an aebleskiver pan but need a recipe, here are ours for a basic aebleskiver batter and a bananas foster filling. Read more about these little pancakelike breakfast treats here....
recipeIngredient: 3 tablespoons sugar (add more for sweet varieties)
About 2 tablespoons melted butter or margarine

recipeInstructions.text: In one bowl, combine all dry ingredients. In another, melt the butter and add the wet. This batter can easily (and quite successfully) be substituted with Bisquick or your favorite pancake mix—the difference is practically undetectable.

Cut bananas into slices, then quarters. In a skillet over medium heat, cook the bananas with the brown sugar until sugar has turned into a caramel, about a minute. Add cinnamon and mix well. Pour in the rum and quickly (but carefully) flambée. (This can be done by tipping the skillet so that the rum makes contact with the gas flame, or with a long-handled lighter.) Allow the flame to cook the bananas gently for a few seconds; it will go out on its own. Remove from heat and enjoy as an ice cream topping or perfect aebelskiver filling. Remember to lick the spoon—it’s a crime not to.
